body:
Your stack trace contains `local_artifact_repo.py` which indicates you're saving artifacts on the local file system. Are you sure this is really correct? Here's code that prints out what the artifact URI points to?

```python
import mlflow

with mlflow.start_run():
    print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri())
```

@harupy os.mkdir above is not working on my macOS, it is saying "read only file system" even with sudo and all. 
below _get_artifact_uri_ returned this value: _/app/mlruns/0/c9b60459303d460c832daa094315c1b5/artifacts_
Strange thing is if I run above code with some run id in it like this:
```
with mlflow.start_run(run_id = ...) as run:
    mlflow.pyfunc.log_mode....
   ```
then it is working perfectly fine, and _get_artifact_uri_ also returns this expected value: 
s3://mlflow-artifacts-bucket/140643/84ab8b9aa084470290141388637f1128/artifacts
can you try saving artifacts in a different directory by creating a new experiment?
I guess the run you used is stored in an experiment whose artifact URI points to S3.
`/app/mlruns/0/c9b60459303d460c832daa094315c1b5/artifacts` indicates the default experiment is used.

We are using ceph storage for storing artifacts. By default if we dont provide any run_id then it should automatically create a new run id and log the artifacts on the ceph storage. The same piece of code was working fine a few days ago, but we dont know what happened after that.
The expected behaviour is it should log the artifacts in the ceph storage everytime we call mlflow.pyfunc.log_model even without a run_id. I dont know why it is pointing to /app/mlruns.....
Can you print out the tracking URI by `mlflow.get_tracking_uri`?
Yes, it is printing it correctly whatever I have set in above code by mlflow.set_tracking_uri(...)
Have you tried `mlflow.set_experiment` to explicitly set an experiment?

Tried it, and now it is working fine
```
mlflow.create_experiment("demo_exp2")
mlflow.set_experiment("demo_exp2")
with mlflow.start_run() as run:
    mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(....)
```
But I dont understand why do we require to set experiment? The same thing was working before also, why not now.
Do you remember in which experiment you were logging before?

The above code that I have provided in the issue was working fine before. I did not create any experiment manually before. According to the documentation, if no experiment is provided then it will take the default experiment as defined by the tracking server. So that might be the cause of this error ?
Can we know what is the default experiment used by the tracking server ?

Hi, I checked. You were right, the artifact uri of the default experiment is set to this: /app/mlruns/0. So I think this is the cause of my error, to mitigate this, we should always define an experiment before whatever we do with mlflow, right ?

> we should always define an experiment before whatever we do with mlflow, right?

Not always. For example, if you just want to test mlflow's new features, you can use the default experiment, but if you want to do parameter tuning, I think you should create a separate experiment.
Got it. I think this is not a bug in mlflow then. I am closing this issue. Thank you for your help @harupy . Much appreciated.
